summary:
The Security Council, 
Determining the situation in the Former Yugoslavia remains a threat to international peace and security, 
Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter, 
1. Authorizes Member States, through or with the EU, to establish EUFOR ALTHEA, a multinational stabilization force, for 12 months, as the legal successor to SFOR, under unified command and control, to fulfil its missions regarding the implementation of Annexes 1-A and 2 of the General Framework Agreement for Peace in Bosnia and Herzegovina. 
2. Renews the authorization provided by paragraph 11 of its resolution 2183 (2014) for 12 months. 
3. Authorizes Member States to take necessary measures to implement and ensure compliance with Annexes 1-A and 2, holding parties equally responsible for compliance. 
4. Authorizes Member States to take necessary measures in defence of EUFOR ALTHEA or NATO presence and to assist them in carrying out their missions. 
5. Authorizes Member States to take necessary measures to ensure compliance with airspace rules and procedures over Bosnia and Herzegovina. 
6. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
